medical_history.chief_complaint: Insulin-treated gestational diabetes with persistent fasting hyperglycemia after delivery.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was diagnosed with diabetes in the seventh week of gestation and was asymptomatic but had mild fasting hyperglycemia. Following an uncomplicated pregnancy, she discontinued insulin after delivery, but mild fasting hyperglycemia persisted.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of diabetes includes mother and one sister diagnosed with type 1 diabetes at ages 32 and 11 years respectively, another sister with a history of gestational diabetes, and daughter diagnosed with type 1 diabetes at age 3 years.
